chapter_title: BE ROYAL IN YOUR OWN FASHION: ACT LIKE A KING TO BE TREATED LIKE ONE
summary: In this chapter, Robert Greene emphasizes the importance of self-respect and the demeanor one projects to garner respect from others. He illustrates how Louis-Philippe, a former king, lost his power by downplaying his royalty and mingling too casually with the people. Through historical examples like Columbus and the lessons from kingship, Greene highlights that one's self-image and confidence involve taking on a regal posture, inspiring respect through dignity. By embodying a quality that reflects greatness, people are often treated as if they are destined for it. Ultimately, to command respect, one must act as a king, regardless of their actual status.

slides.section_body: How you carry yourself influences how others perceive and treat you. A regal presence inspires respect and commands authority. Cultivating self-respect is crucial for anyone aiming for greatness.
slides.quote: Appear regal and confident, and you may find the world treating you accordingly.

slides.section_title: The Rise and Fall of Louis-Philippe
slides.section_body: Louis-Philippe attempted to downplay his royal status to be relatable, but ultimately lost the respect of both the elite and the common people. His lack of regal demeanor led to his downfall, showcasing the importance of maintaining an aura of authority.
slides.quote: Scoffing at grandeur may seem progressive, but it can mask profound weakness.

slides.section_body: Believing that you are destined for greatness elevates your presence and expectations. The Strategy of the Crown teaches us to demand respect through self-belief and confidence. It transforms our interactions and opportunities.
slides.quote: Set your expectations high; the world often responds in kind.

slides.section_body: True regal confidence is not arrogance. It encompasses dignity and assurance without diminishing others. The right kind of demeanor draws people in rather than pushing them away.
slides.quote: Arrogance betrays insecurity; regal bearing is the guard against it.

slides.section_body: Christopher Columbus, despite his humble origin, projected an elegant confidence that won him the favor of kings. His demands were bold, and he successfully enchanted the nobility with his regal self-assurance.
slides.quote: Confidence, not competence, often opens doors to greatness.

slides.section_body: In challenging situations, maintaining dignity can turn adversity into respect. The posture you present during trials defines who you are. Embrace grace, even in difficult times.
slides.quote: Dignity under fire marks true leaders from the rest.

slides.section_body: Powerful figures often set themselves apart through their demeanor. Acting with regal confidence can shift the perception of leadership and authority.
slides.quote: Radiate the essence of royalty, and observe how others respond to your presence.

slides.section_body: A false sense of commonality can backfire. Effective leaders know how to connect without stripping away their grandeur. Strive for equality in purpose, not appearance.
slides.quote: True leaders never forget the distance that defines respect.

slides.section_body: Projecting a royal image includes bold demands and confidence in interactions. Position yourself at the high end of negotiations to assert your worth.
slides.quote: Your self-worth determines how the world values you.

slides.section_body: You are the architect of your own value in society. Embrace the crown of confidence, for it is through this lens you will change your destiny. Shape the perception of your worth.
slides.quote: Never settle for less than you deserve; act like the royalty you aspire to be.
